entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Tuesday Night Through Thursday... Snow is expected over the Central and Eastern North Slope from Tue night into Thursday. There could be 1-2 inches of snow over the Central and Eastern North Slope, with up to 4 inches in the Brooks Range above 2000 ft. This could make travel difficult over the Brooks Range Passes.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:29PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Along the Yukon River Into the Weekend... Water levels on the Yukon River will continue to rise and reach bankfull and likely go overbank in low lying areas over the next few days. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 1:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels On Most Rivers This Week... Warm temperatures across the Southeast Interior are causing significant high elevation snowmelt. Ice is now gone from most rivers across the Southeast Interior, but many rivers and streams will run high from the snowmelt and cover sloughs and gravel bars with water.
